answers.answer: Hi,How are you? What other symptoms are present? Prolonged menstruation may be attributed to changes in hormone levels,  gyencological issues such as uterine polyps or fibroids; medical conditions such as thyroid and pituitary disorders or diabetes; pregnancy complications, medication side effect, infection, stress, change in diet or exercise routine, recent weight loss or weight gain, travel, or illness. If it has been 20 days already, it is best that you have this checked by your doctor for proper evaluation. Direct physical examination and additional tests may need to be done to determine the underlying cause. Take care and do keep us posted.

question: I HAVE been on my period for 20 days whats wrong with me
title: 20 day period
